snippet: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, the results from the Quinnipiac University survey provided vindication as he seeks to address deep-seated tensions with the Police Department.
abstract: Quinnipiac University poll shows that New York City residents overwhelmingly disapprove of back-turning protests and work slowdowns undertaken by police officers in protest of Mayor Bill de Blasio; findings bolster embattled mayor as he seeks resolution to issues with Police Department.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, the results from the Quinnipiac University survey provided vindication as he seeks to address deep-seated tensions with the Police Department.

headline.main: Voters Disapprove of Police Officers’ Protests and Work Slowdown, Poll Finds
headline.print_headline: Voters Disapprove of Police Officers’ Protests and Work Slowdown, Poll Finds
